item.title: C++ compilation notes (CMake + libxml++)
item.description: Let’s set up a simple C++ program that links to libxml++ on Ubuntu 18.04. First, we’ll install libxml++ from apt. sudo apt install libxml++2.6-dev This installs a pre-built libxml++ shared object, and also header files that we’ll need for development. Sidenote: If you simply want to install libxml++ as a dependency for another app, and aren’t planning on doing any dev work, you can simply download the libxml++2.6-2v5 package, which only contains the shared objects, and no headers.
